intro: Paranephelium xestophyllum, commonly known as the ghost fern, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Athyriaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent fronds that give it a ghostly appearance, particularly in low light conditions. The plant exhibits a unique growth pattern, often forming dense clumps with intricate, lace-like leaf structures. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a challenging plant to cultivate outside its native range.
